articles.title: Bangladesh stops new import permits for onion from India
articles.summary: Bangladesh has halted new onion import permits from India, prioritizing domestic farmers. While 10 lakh tonnes are exported to Bangladesh, Indian onions remain sought after globally. Imports under existing permits will proceed until January 30, as Indian exporters seek government subsidies to compete internationally.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Capex in the driver’s seat of India’s growth story
articles.summary: Budget 2026: With the FY2027 Union Budget looming, there lies a crucial opportunity for the government to concentrate on amplifying domestic potential and fostering growth. Elevating capital expenditure is key to improving infrastructure and spurring private investments. A renewed spotlight on production-linked incentive schemes can galvanise the National Manufacturing Mission, serving as a lifeline for MSMEs and innovative startups.

articles.title: No call from PM Modi to Trump blocked India-US trade deal, US commerce secy says
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick claimed that a stalled India-US trade deal was due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi not calling President Donald Trump. Lutnick stated the deal required leader-to-leader political signaling, which did not occur, leading to India's discomfort and the lack of a call.

articles.title: Trump's 500% tariff threat more of a pressure tactic: Oil industry
articles.summary: In a striking political maneuver, US President Donald Trump is endorsing legislation that would impose a staggering 500% tariff on Russian oil purchasers. Indian oil executives perceive this as a tactical pressure play in ongoing trade negotiations rather than a serious ultimatum. The intention appears to be to coerce India while nudging Russia towards a more peaceful resolution.

articles.title: 500% Trump Tariffs? India could pay the price on Russian oil sanctions while China cruises free
articles.summary: A proposed sanctions bill in the US is set to deliver heavy tariffs on nations importing inexpensive Russian oil. India could face significant repercussions, while China appears insulated from these measures.

articles.title: Budget 2026: How India can mobilise capital for its next growth leap
articles.summary: Union Budget: Policy and regulatory support helped boost consumption in 2025, reflected in strong GST collections and higher retail credit, aided by income tax relief, GST rate rationalisation and a cumulative 125-basis-point repo rate cut by the RBI. Retail lending led credit growth, while bank credit is expected to grow 11–12% and NBFC/HFC lending 18–19% this fiscal. However, weak deposit mobilisation and sluggish private investment remain concerns.

articles.title: Leather exports hit by US tariffs: Industry tells Parl panel
articles.summary: The Indian leather industry met with a Parliamentary Standing Committee on Commerce, highlighting that 50% US tariffs are significantly harming exports and impacting the sector's competitiveness. They urged for bilateral engagements to address trade barriers and requested policy and diplomatic support to mitigate socio-economic consequences.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal invites Liechtenstein investment in India
articles.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal urged Liechtenstein companies to invest in India, leveraging the India-EFTA trade pact for expansion. He highlighted India's scale, talent, and manufacturing depth, complementing Liechtenstein's specialized industrial and financial expertise. The minister encouraged collaboration to build resilient value chains and a reliable investment bridge in a volatile global environment.

articles.title: GDP growth to slip to 6.8% in FY27, limited scope for rate cuts: Report
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs forecasts India's GDP growth to slow to 6.8 percent in FY27. Inflation is expected to rise, restricting the Reserve Bank's ability to lower interest rates. Private investment remains subdued. The rupee's depreciation is likely nearing its end. The current account deficit is projected at 1 percent in 2026. A US-India trade deal delay could pressure the currency.

articles.title: US job growth slows in December; unemployment rate eases to 4.4%
articles.summary: U.S. job growth slowed more than expected in December amid ‍business caution about hiring because of import tariffs ​and rising artificial intelligence investment, but the unemployment rate dipped to 4.4%, supporting expectations ⁠the Federal Reserve would leave interest rates unchanged this month.

articles.title: US Supreme Court verdict on Trump tariff tonight: How Sensex, Nifty may get impacted
articles.summary: The US Supreme Court ruling on Trump-era tariffs could spark sharp gains or deepen volatility in Sensex and Nifty. India faces double exposure with 50% tariffs and a potential 500% levy on Russian oil imports, affecting trade and corporate profits.

articles.title: 2025: A milestone in India-Singapore relations
articles.summary: India and Singapore marked 60 years of diplomatic relations in 2025. High-level visits by leaders from both nations strengthened their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. A roadmap was unveiled to deepen trade and market access. Defence cooperation saw significant engagements, including maritime exercises. Various ministerial and parliamentary delegations also exchanged visits, underscoring the robust bilateral ties.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,750 amid trade pact worries
articles.summary: Indian stocks extended losses for a fourth session on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty falling amid U.S.-India trade deal uncertainty. However, a rebound in the rupee and renewed foreign investor buying offered some support. Global markets also saw declines, particularly in technology shares, while oil prices advanced due to geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: US-India trade deal didn't happen because PM Modi didn't call President Trump, claims Lutnick
articles.summary: US Commerce Secretary claimed in the podcast interview that India could have had a lower tariff than Indonesia, Vietnam and others if the deal was closed earlier.

articles.title: Top Stories | Markets shed ₹8 lakh cr, Trump’s 500% tariff threat, Noida airport telecom tussle & more
articles.summary: Top 10@10—CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights—delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: India’s power sector may see limited impact if Chinese curbs are scrapped: PL Capital
articles.summary: Amit Anwani of PL Capital said any easing of Chinese import restrictions is unlikely to be broad-based and will depend on government notification. He said government-led power orders and localisation reduce risks for domestic players like BHEL, while transmission companies could see limited margin impact. Execution and balance sheet strength remain key factors to watch.

articles.title: India stands by energy policy amid US tariff threat, rejects blame on Modi for stalled trade deal
articles.summary: The threat of 500% tariff also comes amid a prolonged trade negotiation between the US and India, that the MEA said, came close to finalising on several occasions.

articles.title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet clears ₹10 hike on liquor prices, eases burden on bars
articles.summary: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet led by N Chandrababu Naidu hikes IMFL MRP by ₹10, eases bar taxes, permits microbreweries, and launches APLINC and Andhra Pradesh Logistics Fund for infrastructure growth.

articles.title: Income tax return filing: Here's what happens if you miss the ITR deadline
articles.summary: Missing the Income Tax Return filing deadline doesn’t end your tax obligation, but it can make it more expensive and restrictive. From late filing fees and interest charges to limits on refunds and loss carry-forward, this photo story breaks down what changes when you file late and why timing matters as much as accuracy.

articles.title: How Indians earned in 2025: ClearTax's ITR filing report reveals shift to multi-source income
articles.summary: ClearTax’s 2025 report shows India’s shift to multi-income sources, with millennials and Gen Z driving growth in business, trading, investments, and digital assets, especially via ITR-2 and ITR-3.

articles.title: Raymond Vickery: Trump's Ego And 'Shaky Legal Grounds' For Tariffs Are Stalling India Trade Deal
articles.summary: Raymond Vickery: Trump's Ego And 'Shaky Legal Grounds' For Tariffs Are Stalling India Trade Deal

articles.title: Affordable energy for 1.4 billion people remains top priority: MEA on 500% US tariff threat
articles.summary: Amid reports that the US administration is considering a 500% tariff on countries continuing to buy Russian oil, the government says its focus remains on securing affordable and dependable energy supplies.

articles.title: Trump’s Russia oil crackdown: Why India faces the threat of 500% US tariffs
articles.summary: With the US President backing a Bill to penalise buyers of Russian oil, India could face US tariffs of at least 500%, turning energy security into a high-stakes trade flashpoint.

articles.title: ED seeks CBI probe against CM Mamata, top police officials in I-PAC raid case
articles.summary: The high court is expected to hear the writ petition of the federal agency on Friday.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026 set for a Sunday: Dates, history and key expectations
articles.summary: The budget session of the Parliament will begin on Jan 28. The Economic Survey is scheduled to be tabled on Jan 29 and the Union Budget 2026 on Feb 1.

articles.title: Respect judiciary, India tells New York mayor Zohran Mamdani on Umar Khalid note
articles.summary: Zohran Mamdani, who is of Indian origin, had handed over a handwritten note expressing solidarity with Khalid when he met the activist’s parents in the US in December

articles.title: Union Budget To Be Presented On February 1 (Sunday), Economic Survey On January 29
articles.summary: The Union Budget for 2025-26 will be tabled in Parliament on February 1 - a Sunday - and the Economic Survey, which is a precursor to the budget document, will be presented by Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran on January 29.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: PLI scheme should be extended to new tech sectors like AI, robotics; here's what EY India recommends
articles.summary: EY India suggests expanding Production-Linked Incentives to AI, space, and robotics, urging the FY27 Budget to prioritize growth and tax certainty. A dedicated Customs dispute resolution mechanism and simplified tariff structures are also proposed. The firm emphasizes clear guidelines for the new Income Tax Act to ensure a smooth transition and boost investor confidence.

केन्द्रीय गृह एवं सहकारिता मंत्री श्री अमित शाह ने आज नई दिल्ली में NCORD की 9वीं शीर्ष-स्तरीय बैठक की अध्यक्षता की
सीएक्यूएम ने गंभीर उल्लंघनों के कारण एनसीआर में 16 औद्योगिक इकाइयों को बंद करने के निर्देश जारी किए
अस्पतालों और खेतों में उपयोगी सेंसर बनाने के लिए पेंसिल, कागज और ग्राफीन को एक साथ लाया गया
प्रधानमंत्री ने हिमाचल प्रदेश के सिरमौर में हुई बस दुर्घटना में हुई जनहानि पर गहरा दुख व्यक्त किया
केंद्रीय कृषि मंत्री श्री शिवराज सिंह चौहान ने राज्यों के कृषि मंत्रियों के साथ की समीक्षा बैठक
रक्षा अनुसंधान और विकास संगठन ने हाइपरसोनिक मिसाइल कार्यक्रम के लिए फुल स्केल एक्टिवली कूल्ड लॉन्ग ड्यूरेशन स्क्रैमजेट इंजन का सफल ग्राउंड परीक्षण किया
केंद्रीय कृषि मंत्री ने कृषि क्षेत्र में भारत-फिजी सहयोग को और मजबूत करने के लिए अपने फिजी समकक्ष के साथ द्विपक्षीय बैठक की
राष्ट्रीय खनिज चिंतन शिविर 2026 का शुभारंभ, विकसित भारत 2047 के लिए एक मजबूत नींव का निर्माण
इस्पात मंत्रालय ने ‘भारत स्टील अवार्ड्स-2026’ के लिए आवेदन आमंत्रित किए
प्रकाशन विभाग, नई दिल्ली विश्व पुस्तक मेले 2026 में पुस्तकों और पत्रिकाओं का समृद्ध संग्रह लेकर आया है
भारतीय रेलवे ने 2026 की समय सारणी में 549 ट्रेनों की रफ्तार बढ़ाई जिससे यात्रा समय में कमी आई और कार्यकुशलता बढ़ी
संक्रामक रोगों से लेकर व्यक्तिगत चिकित्सा तक, भारत एक भविष्योन्मुखी स्वास्थ्य सेवा चरण में प्रवेश किया है: डॉ. जितेंद्र सिंह
केंद्रीय शिक्षा मंत्री श्री धर्मेंद्र प्रधान ने नई दिल्ली में समग्र शिक्षा 3.0 - ' नए सिरे से समग्र शिक्षा की परिकल्पना’ संबंधी बैठक की अध्यक्षता की
केंद्रीय मंत्री डॉ. मनसुख मांडविया ने सरकार द्वारा गुजरात सरकार और भारतीय ओलंपिक संघ (आईओए) के सहयोग से आयोजित 'खेल प्रशासन सम्मेलन' को संबोधित किया
उपराष्ट्रपति श्री सीपी राधाकृष्णन ने नई दिल्ली में भारतीय भाषाओं पर तीसरे अंतर्राष्ट्रीय सम्मेलन का उद्घाटन किया
देश में उर्वरकों का रिकॉर्ड उत्पादन
सेनाध्‍यक्ष जनरल उपेंद्र द्विवेदी के संयुक्त अरब अमीरात और श्रीलंका के दौरे से रक्षा सहयोग मजबूत हुआ
गुवाहाटी में वस्त्र मंत्रियों का राष्ट्रीय सम्मेलन आज प्रमुख नीतिगत विचार-विमर्श और भविष्य की रूपरेखा के साथ संपन्न हुआ

articles.title: Mapping Judicial Time: A Two-by-Two Framework for Categorising Listings
articles.summary: In this blog post, Gokul Krishnan R proposes a novel two-by-two framework for categorising case listings in Indian trial courts. The framework classifies listings based on their nature (procedural or substantive) and their effectiveness in advancing cases toward resolution. This approach provides a nuanced understanding of judicial time utilisation, moving beyond traditional definitions of "effective hearing".

articles.title: Delay in Form 10AB Filing Excused Due to Late Grant of Prior Approval
articles.summary: Holding that there was no real delay, the Tribunal directed grant of section 80G approval. The decision stresses practical and reasonable interpretation of filing timelines. The post Delay in Form 10AB Filing Excused Due to Late Grant of Prior Approval appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Addition Set Aside for Lack of Cross-Examination Opportunity
articles.summary: An addition based on a third-party statement was challenged for denial of cross-examination. The Tribunal held that natural justice must be followed and directed a fresh hearing. The post Addition Set Aside for Lack of Cross-Examination Opportunity appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed for Wrong Approval Under Section 151
articles.summary: The issue was whether reassessment beyond three years was valid without approval from the correct authority. ITAT held the notice void as sanction was taken from the wrong officer, reaffirming strict compliance with Section 151. The post Reassessment Quashed for Wrong Approval Under Section 151 appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 143(1) Adjustment Cannot Deny 115BAB Concessional Rate
articles.summary: Denial of the 15% rate through summary processing was held invalid. Eligibility under section 115BAB requires examination and hearing, not mechanical CPC adjustments. The post Section 143(1) Adjustment Cannot Deny 115BAB Concessional Rate appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reopening Quashed for Non-Supply of Material Relied Upon in Reasons
articles.summary: The issue was whether reopening is valid when the information relied upon is not shared. The Tribunal held that failure to supply such material violates natural justice and vitiates reassessment. The post Reopening Quashed for Non-Supply of Material Relied Upon in Reasons appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Condones 3,100 Days Delay, Appeal Sent Back
articles.summary: The issue was whether an extraordinary delay caused by non-communication of intimation and a CPC error could be condoned. ITAT held the delay was unintentional, imposed costs, and remanded the case for adjudication on merits. The post ITAT Condones 3,100 Days Delay, Appeal Sent Back appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Estimated Commission Addition Unsustainable Without Rejecting Books
articles.summary: The issue was whether commission income could be estimated without rejecting books of account. The Tribunal ruled that estimation without invoking section 145(3) and section 144 is impermissible. The post Estimated Commission Addition Unsustainable Without Rejecting Books appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 68 Addition Deleted After Loan Genuineness Proven
articles.summary: The Revenue argued that routing through banking channels was insufficient. The Tribunal rejected this contention, holding that complete documentary evidence satisfied all requirements of Section 68. The post Section 68 Addition Deleted After Loan Genuineness Proven appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Accommodation Entry Allegation Rejected for Want of Proof
articles.summary: The ruling reiterates that reassessment cannot be sustained where documentary evidence shows no loan transaction. Incorrect third-party information cannot justify reopening. The post Accommodation Entry Allegation Rejected for Want of Proof appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Pune Deletes Section 234E Late Fee for Pre-1 June 2015 TDS Return Processing
articles.summary: The case dealt with a TDS return processed in March 2015 where late fee was levied. The Tribunal held such levy to be without jurisdiction under the law then in force. The post ITAT Pune Deletes Section 234E Late Fee for Pre-1 June 2015 TDS Return Processing appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 80P Deduction Cannot Be Denied by CPC for AY 2019-20
articles.summary: The issue was whether CPC could disallow Section 80P deduction while processing the return under Section 143(1). The Tribunal held that CPC lacked such power for AY 2019-20 as the enabling amendment came later. The post Section 80P Deduction Cannot Be Denied by CPC for AY 2019-20 appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: No Penalty for Recharacterising Capital Gains as Business Income
articles.summary: The Assessing Officer imposed penalty after treating disclosed capital gains as business income. The Tribunal ruled that classification disputes, without suppression of facts, cannot justify penalty. The post No Penalty for Recharacterising Capital Gains as Business Income appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 69 Addition Quashed Because Housing Loan Explained Source
articles.summary: The issue was whether cash and cheque payments could be taxed as unexplained investment in AY 2013–14. The Tribunal held that the major payments pertained to FY 2010–11 and could not be assessed in a later year. The post Section 69 Addition Quashed Because Housing Loan Explained Source appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reopening Quashed for Mechanical “Bogus Sub-Contractor” Reasons
articles.summary: The issue was whether reassessment based on identical, template reasons was valid. The Tribunal held that reopening without independent application of mind amounts to borrowed satisfaction and is invalid in law. The post Reopening Quashed for Mechanical “Bogus Sub-Contractor” Reasons appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: No Section 68 Addition When Capital Introduction Pertains to Another Year
articles.summary: The Tribunal upheld deletion of a ₹2.27 crore addition after finding that the capital deposit did not pertain to the assessment year in question. Without a year-wise nexus, section 68 could not be invoked. The post No Section 68 Addition When Capital Introduction Pertains to Another Year appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Low-Margin Trading Business Justifies 2% Profit Estimation
articles.summary: The issue was determination of income when the assessee failed to maintain books of account. The Tribunal held that an 8% or 4% estimate was excessive and fixed profit at a reasonable 2% of turnover. The post Low-Margin Trading Business Justifies 2% Profit Estimation appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 40A(3) Disallowance Set Aside in Invalid Reassessment
articles.summary: The case examined whether reassessment after four years was valid when the issues were already examined in scrutiny. The Tribunal held the reopening invalid as a mere change of opinion and quashed the reassessment. The post Section 40A(3) Disallowance Set Aside in Invalid Reassessment appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Delay in Filing Condoned for Old Trust, Registration Matter Restored
articles.summary: Recognising the non-commercial nature of a long-standing charitable trust, the Tribunal condoned the delay. The registration application was sent back for reconsideration on merits. The post Delay in Filing Condoned for Old Trust, Registration Matter Restored appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 270A Penalty Case Remanded After Delay Condoned
articles.summary: Where the CIT(A) rejected the appeal only on limitation, the Tribunal intervened. It directed fresh adjudication of the penalty after condoning the 380-day delay. The post Section 270A Penalty Case Remanded After Delay Condoned appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Specific Performance Granted After POA Ratification Affidavit
articles.summary: The Supreme Court held that a subsequent affidavit ratifying acts of a power-of-attorney holder revived the agreement and reset limitation. articles.title: Rejection of 12A Registration Set Aside for Fresh Hearing on Delay

articles.summary: Direction is in line with SC's 7 November order asking all states/UTs and Centre to secure educational institutions and other public places from stray canines, says UGC.

articles.title: Recognition, funding, autonomy. Educationists divided over single higher education regulator Bill
articles.summary: Vikshit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill proposes setting up an overarching higher education commission along with 3 councils for regulation, accreditation   standards of universities.

articles.title: Dharmendra Pradhan defends higher education overhaul Bill—‘no threat to autonomy of states’
articles.summary: Union Minister’s remarks come after Oppn parties raise concerns about ‘excessive centralisation’ of higher education in India. Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill referred to JPC.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: UPSC to ensure no PwBD candidate denied centre of choice for examination
articles.summary: Move aims to ease logistics for PwBD candidates by guaranteed seats even at popular centres like Delhi, Patna and Lucknow; commission to increase capacity at centres.

articles.title: Auroville-IIT Madras land row: House panel echoes residents, recommends alternative site for campus
articles.summary: A section of Auroville residents had protested the MoU signing 100 acres of Auroville to IIT-Madras saying it would displace Annapurna Farm, the community’s central granary.

articles.title: Democratic senators demand Apple, Google take X and Grok off app stores over sexual images: Report
articles.summary: Three Democratic ⁠US senators are ‌calling ‌on Apple and ‌Alphabet's Google to remove X and Grok ​from ​their respective ‌app ‍stores ‍over the spread of ‌nonconsensual sexual images of women and ‍minors on ‍the ⁠platforms, ⁠NBC News reported Friday.

articles.title: L&T Semiconductor Technologies forays into cellular IoT module business
articles.summary: The first module, powered by Qualcomm, will be produced in collaboration with Indian EMS partners to ensure scale and quality for deployments in both domestic and global markets.

articles.title: VC firm Andreessen Horowitz raises over $15 billion across multiple funds
articles.summary: The funds, which account for over 18% of all VC funds allocated in the US last year, will be invested in core technology platforms, including AI, cryptocurrency, and others. The geopolitical developments have caused the firm to change its investment strategy to invest in emerging technologies that can compete with China.

articles.title: TSMC fourth-quarter revenue jumps 20%, beats forecasts
articles.summary: TSMC reported a 20.45% increase in fourth-quarter revenue from a year earlier, ‌beating the market forecast, as demand for the company's products leapt in response to surging interest in AI applications.

articles.title: Physical AI dominates CES but humanity will still have to wait a while for humanoid servants
articles.summary: The annual event draws the biggest companies from the global tech and auto industries who this ⁠year underscored the shift from AI software to "physical AI" with robotics, humanoids and autonomous driving technology.

articles.title: China probes competition among food delivery platforms to curb price war
articles.summary: China will investigate cutthroat ‍competition among food delivery ​platforms operated by tech firms such as Meituan ⁠and Alibaba, aiming to rein in price wars that have eroded profits and contributed to deflationary pressures plaguing the economy.

articles.title: EU considers designating WhatsApp as very large platform, spokesperson says
articles.summary: Such a designation requires online platforms ‍to do more ‍to ⁠tackle ⁠online illegal and harmful content.

articles.title: Meta strikes nuclear power agreements with three companies
articles.summary: Meta and other Big Tech companies want to secure long-term electricity supplies as artificial intelligence and data centers increase U.S. power demand ‌for the first time in two decades.

articles.title: Grok turns off AI image generation for non-payers after nudes backlash
articles.summary: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok has turned off its image creation feature for non-paying users following backlash over its use to create sexualized deepfakes of women and children. Some users reportedly used Grok to generate pictures of women and children undressed, sometimes putting them in sexualized positions.

articles.title: SoftBank cuts Ola Electric stake to 13.5% amid continued investor sell-offs
articles.summary: SoftBank has cut its stake in Ola Electric to 13.53% after selling shares over recent months. The offloading comes as major investors trim stake amid regulatory pressure, rising competition and operational challenges. Ola’s market share and valuation also dropped sharply over the past year.

articles.title: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw discusses manufacturing of sovereign, high-end GPUs in India with Nvidia officials
articles.summary: India is stepping up plans to build its own graphics processors after talks between minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Nvidia executives. The discussions covered sovereign GPUs and local manufacturing of advanced AI devices. The government is also expanding subsidised access to GPUs to boost domestic AI development.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI quarterly net loss widens to $1.46 billion: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s AI firm xAI posted a net loss of $1.46 billion for the September quarter, despite revenue almost doubling to $107 million, according to a report by Bloomberg. However, when contacted ‌by ‍Reuters for comment, xAI ‍replied with the message, "Legacy Media Lies." This comes as xAI announced a $20 billion funding round to expand its AI capabilities.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI to build $20 billion data centre in Mississippi
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s xAI plans to invest $20 billion in a vast data centre in Southaven, Mississippi, the state’s biggest-ever private project. The site will host "the world's largest supercomputer" with 2 gigawatts of computing power. The announcement comes as xAI faces scrutiny over its data centre projects in the Memphis area.

articles.title: TikTok picked by FIFA as video content partner at 2026 World Cup
articles.summary: FIFA has named TikTok its first preferred social media video platform at the men’s World Cup. Creators will gain special access and limited match content at the 2026 tournament. This partnership will continue through the end of 2026. FIFA said that the deal builds on FIFA and TikTok’s collaboration for the 2023 Women’s World Cup, which generated tens of billions of views.

articles.title: Apple Card switches hands but no immediate changes for users
articles.summary: Apple has confirmed JPMorgan will become the new issuer of the Apple Card, replacing Goldman Sachs, with no changes for customers. Rewards, savings features and Mastercard access will stay the same during the transition. The deal, closing in about two years, solidifies JPMorgan’s leading position in the US credit card market.

articles.title: EU antitrust regulators to decide on Google's Wiz deal by February 10
articles.summary: EU antitrust officials will decide by February 10 on Google owner Alphabet’s planned $32 billion purchase of cybersecurity firm Wiz. Announced last March, the acquisition secured the US green light in November last year. Tech ‍deals have in recent years faced ‌intense regulatory scrutiny on concerns that dominant companies may further boost their market power.

articles.title: Exclusive: Razorpay invites banker pitches for IPO; targets Rs 4,500 crore fundraise
articles.summary: Razorpay has begun formal preparations for a stock market debut, inviting merchant bankers to pitch for its IPO mandate, people familiar with the matter told ET. The digital payments firm is looking to raise up to Rs 4,500 in fresh capital.

articles.title: China is investigating Meta's latest AI acquisition
articles.summary: China is investigating whether Meta's acquisition of the artificial intelligence startup Manus violated its laws on technology exports and outbound investment. Those rules say that the Chinese government must approve the export of certain technologies, including interactive AI systems.

articles.title: Humanoid robots go for knockout in high-tech Vegas fight night
articles.summary: At a CES-adjacent event in Las Vegas, humanoid robots battled in an Ultimate Fighting Robot match at BattleBots Arena. Controlled by human pilots, the MMA-style fights aim to boost entertainment, attract fans to humanoid robotics, and collect movement data for research and development.

articles.title: Dose of uncertainty: Experts wary of AI health gadgets at CES
articles.summary: At CES, health gadgets promise better heart, fertility and menopause care, but experts warn of shaky accuracy and privacy. As the FDA relaxes oversight under AI-friendly policies, innovators tout access and efficiency, while critics stress bias, data misuse and that consumer tech can’t replace doctors.

articles.title: Gmail's new AI features, turning it into personal assistant
articles.summary: The new AI features announced Thursday could herald a pivotal moment for Gmail, a service that transformed email when it was introduced nearly 22 years ago. Since then, Gmail has amassed more than 3 billion users to become nearly as ubiquitous as Google's search engine.

articles.title: IIIT Dharwad to deploy India's first commercial quantum computer, says Karnataka IT/BT minister Priyank Kharge
articles.summary: The Indian Institute of Information Technology, Dharwad (IIIT-D), will deploy India's first commercial quantum computer at its newly announced Centre for Excellence in Quantum AI and Computing, said Karnataka IT/BT Minister Priyank Kharge.

articles.title: Flipkart appoints Gunjan Bhartia as SVP business finance
articles.summary: The company said that Bhartia will lead business finance for Flipkart's in-house logistics unit eKart across all verticals. He has previously held senior positions at companies such as GE and Coupang.

articles.title: Apple loses Safari lead designer to Browser Company, the firm behind AI browsers Arc & Dia
articles.summary: Apple's senior leadership continues to see significant departures, with its lead Safari designer, Marco Triverio, joining The Browser Company. This move means The Browser Company now employs lead designers from every Safari era overlapping with their Arc and Dia browsers (2020-2025). The company aims to build the industry's most exceptional AI interface and product talent team.

articles.title: Microsoft layoffs: Company denies reports of 22,000 job cuts
articles.summary: Microsoft has denied reports it plans to cut up to 22,000 jobs, calling the claims unfounded. The rumours, which spread online, suggested wide-ranging layoffs across key divisions - gaming, Azure, and sales. While recent job cuts have fuelled scepticism, the company says no such move is planned.

articles.title: Dancing isn't enough: Industry pushes for practical robots
articles.summary: Humanoid robots danced, somersaulted, dealt blackjack and played ping-pong at the Consumer Electronics Show this week, but some in the industry are impatient for them to become more useful, not just a promise of things to come. - According to the Consumer Technology Association that runs CES, the robotics industry is showing dynamism and potential.

articles.title: Discord, Snap investor Niko Bonatsos departs General Catalyst, plans new VC firm
articles.summary: Niko Bonatsos has quit General Catalyst after a 15-year tenure, a mutual decision that sees him exploring new ventures. He plans to launch his own firm, focusing on backing young founders, particularly within the burgeoning AI startup scene. This exit follows other senior departures from the venture capital firm.

articles.title: JPMorgan to replace Goldman as Apple Card issuer
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase will replace Goldman Sachs as the issuer of the Apple Card, bringing over $20 billion in balances to its platform. The deal strengthens JPMorgan’s credit card business, while Goldman continues to scale back consumer operations. Completion depends on regulatory approval and is expected in about two years.

articles.title: Amagi Media trims IPO size, targets $869 million post-money valuation to woo investors
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs has cut the size and pricing of its IPO, valuing the company below its previous $1.4 billion valuation. The move reflects strong cash flows, reduced need for dilution and investor feedback. The listing highlights a wider reset in valuations across enterprise software firms.

articles.title: Arali Ventures nets 23x return on full exit from HBOX
articles.summary: This follows remote health technology startup HBOX securing strategic growth investment from the Charlesbank Technology Opportunities Fund. Arali Ventures had invested in HBOX at the time of its inception. HBOX is a US-headquartered remote health technology startup, with its core engineering and delivery teams based in India.

articles.title: Trump shifts FTC pick to White House role advising on tech and competition
articles.summary: The White House ‍is withdrawing its nomination ​of Ryan Baasch for a Federal Trade Commission ⁠seat and instead naming him deputy director of the National Economic Council, elevating his role in shaping tech, telecom and competition policy.

articles.title: Tech firms must block unsolicited nude images under new UK rules
articles.summary: Technology companies in Britain will be required to block ‍unsolicited sexual images under ​online safety rules taking effect on Thursday, as governments ⁠worldwide step up efforts to curb abuse and risks linked to artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Chinese tech companies, led by Zhipu AI, to rise in Hong Kong debut
articles.summary: Three ‍Chinese technology firms ​are set to ⁠debut higher on Thursday after raising a combined HK$9.3 billion ($1.19 ‌billion), ‌setting the tone for what investors ‌hope will be a busier year for new listings in Hong Kong.

articles.title: Judge indicates Elon Musk's fraud lawsuit against OpenAI will head to trial
articles.summary: A US judge has signalled that a jury will hear Elon Musk’s lawsuit accusing OpenAI of misleading him over its shift from a non-profit to a profit-driven company. The case will go to trial, likely involving testimony from Musk and chief Sam Altman. A 2017 diary entry by OpenAI executive Greg Brockman was among the information that Gonzalez Rogers cited to support her rationale for allowing Musk's lawsuit to go to trial.

articles.title: OpenAI earmarks $50 billion for employee stock grant pool: The Information
articles.summary: OpenAI reportedly reserved a large share pool for staff in October, said to equal 10% of the firm valued at $500 billion, The Information reported. The company is also exploring new funding talks that might lift its valuation to about $750 billion soon, a 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion valuation in October.

articles.title: Infosys' land sale among transactions Karnataka opens probe into for bypassing e-khata
articles.summary: The revenue authorities have made e-khata, or the digital version of a property’s official record, a compulsory document for the seller to produce for registering a property. The Kaveri 2.0 portal is designed to fetch the e-khata from the e-Swathu portal during registration.

articles.title: Grok’s harmful turn shows clear legal gaps in AI regulation
articles.summary: The majority of the regulatory discussion has focused on proposed changes to the IT Rules, which would require platforms to label synthetic content and follow disclosure and tracking measures. Legal experts argue that this approach mainly places the burden on platforms that distribute content, while leaving significant gaps concerning AI tool developers and app stores that enable misuse.

articles.title: Introducing guardrails, refining safeguards for Grok, X tells Centre
articles.summary: X has told India it is tightening safeguards on its Grok chatbot after government orders over obscene and unlawful content. Authorities are reviewing the response and warned X could lose legal immunity if it fails to comply. Despite assurances, Grok continued generating explicit material, fuelling global criticism.

articles.title: Why Grok, not ChatGPT or Gemini, became epicentre of obscenity backlash
articles.summary: Grok’s Spicy mode has come under fire for generating non-consensual, sexually explicit images. Its deep integration with microblogging platform X has worked to its disadvantage, as Grok can be invoked directly in X posts, replies, and chats, pushing lewd images into the public feed by default.

articles.title: China asks tech firms to halt orders for Nvidia's H200 chips: Report
articles.summary: Beijing has asked ‍some Chinese tech companies to ​halt orders for Nvidia's H200 chips this week, and ⁠is expected to mandate domestic artificial intelligence chip purchases, the Information reported on Wednesday.

articles.title: ASML says social media hacking claims are untrue
articles.summary: Dutch computer ​chip equipment ⁠supplier ASML said on Wednesday that claims ‌posted ‌on social media that ‌the company had been hacked were untrue.

articles.title: HSG's continuation fund to value ByteDance at up to $370 billion: Report
articles.summary: HSG, formerly Sequoia Capital China, is reportedly launching a new fund. This fund is expected to buy some of its shares in TikTok's parent company, ByteDance. The deal values ByteDance between $350 billion and $370 billion. This move comes as ByteDance's valuation continues to soar.

articles.title: Spotify makes it easier for creators to earn, reveals $10 billion podcast spend
articles.summary: Spotify is boosting its creator earnings program and introducing new tools for video podcasters. This move aims to enhance competition with platforms like YouTube and Netflix. The company has invested heavily in podcasts and is now lowering entry thresholds for its monetisation program. Video podcast consumption on Spotify has seen significant growth since the program's launch.

articles.title: Wix calls employees back to office; president says need to be fast due to AI
articles.summary: Zohar said that at a time when AI is having serious implications for business, the decision is driven by the belief that in-person collaboration boosts speed, creativity, problem-solving, and team connection.

articles.title: Meesho senior executive Megha Agarwal resigns
articles.summary: Megha Agarwal, general manager-business, Meesho has quit the ecommerce marketplace, according to a stock exchange filing. Agarwal, who reported directly to founder and CEO Vidit Aatrey, had joined Meesho in 2019 and was elevated to lead the company's growth function in 2022. She took over the role of general manager-business in 2023 when Utkrishta Kumar quit from the position.

articles.title: Chat platform Discord files confidentially for US IPO: Report
articles.summary: Chat platform Discord filed confidentially for an ‌initial ‌public offering in the United States. The US IPO market regained momentum in 2025 after nearly three years of sluggish activity, ​but hopes for a ​stronger rebound were tempered by tariff-driven volatility, ‌a ‍prolonged government shutdown and a late-year ‍selloff in artificial intelligence stocks.

articles.title: Grok obscene AI content: X submits response, IT Ministry deems it 'inadequate'
articles.summary: The government has sought more details from X, including specific action taken on obscene content linked to its Grok AI and steps to prevent a repeat in future, sources said on Wednesday, adding that the response submitted by the firm, while detailed, was not adequate.

articles.title: GameStop announces stock option award for CEO tied to $100 billion market-cap target
articles.summary: The company said Cohen will receive no ​guaranteed pay in the form ​of salary, cash bonuses or ‌stock ‍options under the package, making ‍his compensation entirely "at-risk" of achieving the ambitious ‌targets.

articles.title: Budget Session 2026 to start from January 28, confirms Kiren Rijiju; Budget presentation likely on Feb 1
articles.summary: Budget Session will start on 28 January 2026 and continue till 2 April 2026. President Droupadi Murmu has approved the summoning of Parliament for the Budget Session 2026 and the Union Budget is likely be presented on February 1, a Sunday, followed by a recess for committee examinations. The session will reconvene on March 9.

articles.title: RBI deputy governor pitches for collaboration to deal with frauds
articles.summary: T Rabi Sankar said collaboration between banks and central bank owned Reserve Bank Innovation Hub (RBIH) will both quicken and enhance the capability of these risk mechanisms.

articles.title: Ways and Means Advances limit for Delhi govt fixed at Rs 890 cr: RBI
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has set the Ways and Means Advances limit for the Delhi government at Rs 890 crore. This move will assist the city government in managing temporary gaps between its income and expenses. The central bank will also conduct the Delhi government's general banking business starting January 09, 2026.

articles.title: Budget 2026: PHDCCI recommends reform agenda as spotlight falls on banks, MSMEs
articles.summary: Budget 2026: India's industry body PHDCCI anticipates new government reforms. These include deeper divestment and privatization of public sector enterprises. The aim is to boost corporate activity and protect the economy from export uncertainty. The upcoming budget may clarify the future of public sector banks. Reforms are also expected to support MSMEs and the financial sector.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves fall $9.8 billion to $686.8 billion in first week of 2026
articles.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves saw a significant drop of $9.809 billion. Reserves stood at $686.801 billion in the week ending January 02, 2026. This follows a rise in the previous week. Foreign currency assets and gold reserves also decreased. The Reserve Bank of India monitors these movements closely.

articles.title: Digital frauds: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra calls for collaboration between regulator, regulated to protect customers
articles.summary: While telling banks and other regulated entities to continue to improve their tools, techniques and processes in preventing and tackling digital frauds, Malhotra urged for collaborations in building analytics and tools to detect mule accounts and suspicious transactions timely and pre-emptively.

articles.title: India to focus on skilled jobs, employment quality to achieve inclusive growth: EAC-PM chief S Mahendra Dev
articles.summary: India is shifting its focus towards generating skilled employment and improving job quality, an essential step for sustainable economic development. With a target growth rate of 7.7 percent from 2022-23 to 2025-26, the nation envisions a future where investments, domestic savings, and exports flourish. Emphasizing the manufacturing sector is seen as key to creating more labor-intensive job opportunities.

articles.title: ‘PM Modi and Trump have spoken eight times in 2025’: India rejects Lutnick’s claim that stalled trade talks were due to lack of outreach
articles.summary: India has firmly countered the statements made by US Commerce Secretary Lutnick regarding stalled trade discussions. Officials affirmed that Prime Minister Modi and President Trump are in regular communication, with the Ministry of External Affairs underscoring ongoing high-level interactions.

articles.title: India’s growth miracle in danger? Former CEA warns of tariffs, Chinese imports, and fiscal risks
articles.summary: India's economic landscape is navigating turbulent waters, cautions former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian. He highlights the looming threats posed by US tariffs and competitive pressures from Chinese exports. Moreover, he notes the challenges of domestic fiscal health in this climate.

articles.title: Imbibe spirit of regulations, just don't follow tick-box based compliance culture: RBI Governor to regulated entities
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra called for financial institutions to adopt the spirit of regulations. He stressed collaboration to fight digital frauds. Digital channels offer benefits but also risks. The Governor emphasized partnership between regulators and regulated entities for system stability and consumer protection.

articles.title: RBI MPC 2026: No need to waste bullet when growth high, inflation low, says PwC on central banks's rate cut
articles.summary: RBI Monetary Policy Committee 2026: PwC expert Ranen Banerjee advises the Reserve Bank of India against cutting interest rates. He believes a rate cut now would be a wasted opportunity. Growth is strong and inflation is under control. The Monetary Policy Committee is unlikely to change rates in its upcoming February 2026 meeting. Private investment is not currently driven by interest rates.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman to present Budget on February 1; Parliament session likely from Jan 28
articles.summary: Parliament's Budget session is slated to begin on January 28 with President Murmu's address, followed by the Economic Survey on January 30. The Union Budget will be presented on February 1, a Sunday. Following discussions, Parliament will adjourn for a recess on February 13, reconvening on March 9 and concluding on April 2.

articles.title: India, EU reaffirm farmer, MSME safeguards at FTA talks
articles.summary: India and the European Union are in talks for a Free Trade Agreement. Discussions focus on a modern economic partnership. Both sides aim to safeguard farmers and MSMEs. Negotiations are ongoing to bridge differences. The goal is to conclude the talks soon. This pact could boost Indian exports to the EU market.

articles.title: CPSE Capex reached 74.5% of target by December, set to exceed annual target by fair margin
articles.summary: The Capex for the month of December alone increased by 9.28% to Rs 70,000 crore, with many enterprises exceeding their annual budget target. The growth was led by the Railway board and National Highway Authority of India(NHAI) as they remained the highest spenders.

articles.title: 61,000 crorepati taxpayers added in last one year
articles.summary: India saw a significant rise in wealthy taxpayers. Over 61,000 new individuals joined the crorepati club, bringing the total to 351,000. The number of super-rich individuals, earning over ₹10 crore, also grew substantially. Improved tax compliance and advanced data analytics are credited for this expansion. This trend reflects a growing economy and better adherence to tax regulations across the nation.

articles.title: UN raises India's 2026 GDP forecast to 6.6%, pegs next yr's growth at 6.7%
articles.summary: India's economic horizon shines bright with projections of 6.6% growth by 2026 and 6.7% by 2027, as forecasted by the UN. This surge is fueled by vigorous consumer activity and substantial public investments. With supportive policy initiatives in place, India's position as one of the world's fastest-evolving economies is firmly established.

articles.title: Go Swadeshi: CEA V Anantha Nageswaran calls for urgent indigenisation amid global trade headwinds
articles.summary: The Chief Economic Adviser has spotlighted key industries such as semiconductors, defence production, and critical industrial chemicals for self-sufficiency. Targeting a decrease in import reliance, this plan aspires to elevate India's economic influence internationally.

articles.title: India to grow 6.6% in 2026 on strong consumption, public investment: UN
articles.summary: The UN has upgraded India's economic growth projection to 6.6% for 2026, citing resilient private consumption and strong public investment. Policy measures and lower interest rates are expected to boost near-term growth, with India projected to remain one of the fastest-growing economies globally.

articles.title: UN predicts world economic growth to slip to 2.7% in 2026
articles.summary: Global economic growth is set to slow in 2026 before picking up in 2027. The United States economy is expected to see modest growth. China's economy will continue its expansion. India's growth is projected to remain strong, supported by consumption and public investment. These forecasts come from a United Nations report.

articles.title: Over Rs 1.52 lakh cr locked in Customs disputes; govt may look at amnesty scheme in FY27 Budget
articles.summary: Price Waterhouse Co suggests the government consider an amnesty scheme in the 2026-27 Budget to resolve over Rs 1.52 lakh crore in customs duty litigations. The firm also advocates for rationalizing customs duty slabs to 5-6 and reducing duties on raw materials to address inverted duty structures arising from Free Trade Agreements.

articles.title: RBI considering fresh exporter relief steps after low take‑up of loan moratorium, sources say
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is exploring new measures to aid Indian exporters facing U.S. tariffs. A previous loan repayment moratorium saw limited participation. The central bank is now considering easing eligibility for the moratorium or offering fresh subsidized loans. Discussions are ongoing with export agencies to assess future order flows before finalizing new support.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Why do India’s farms suddenly matter?
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: India's agriculture, despite its challenges, holds immense potential as a global growth engine amidst shifting trade dynamics. Lessons from the shrimp export crisis highlight the power of market diversification and value addition. Budget 2026-27 can unlock this 'power-lifter' role by investing in agri-logistics and predictable trade policies, transforming a managed sector into a strategic asset.

articles.title: 'Goldilocks moment': BJP on India's GDP seen growing 7.4% in FY26
articles.summary: As India gears up for a dynamic economic phase, experts anticipate a substantial 7.4 percent growth in the forthcoming fiscal year, with a continuation of this positive trend through 2027. The encouraging trajectory can be largely attributed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's initiatives aimed at enhancing transparency and driving essential reforms.

articles.title: Finance Ministry plans to scrap curbs on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts, sources say
articles.summary: India's finance ministry is set to remove restrictions on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts. These curbs were imposed in 2020 following border tensions. The move aims to boost commercial ties and address project delays. Several ministries have requested exemptions to overcome constraints. A high-level committee also recommended easing these measures.

articles.title: Auri Grow India launches AI-powered carbon credit agritech platform
articles.summary: Auri Grow India has launched CarbonKrishi, an AI-enabled platform designed to onboard one lakh farmers and generate an estimated Rs 16-50 crore in annual carbon credits. The platform utilizes AI, satellite imagery, and crop data to assess farm-level carbon impact.

articles.title: NITI Aayog invites EoI for preparation of India Innovation Index 2025
articles.summary: India Innovation Index is prepared by the NITI Aayog in collaboration with a suitable knowledge partner. The first edition of the Index, called India Innovation Index 2019 (III 2019), was launched in October, 2019 followed by India Innovation Index 2020 launched in January, 2021, and India Innovation Index 2021 launched in July, 2022.

articles.title: India projected to grow at 6.6%, resilient consumption, public investment to offset US tariffs impact: UN
articles.summary: India's economy is set for robust growth at 6.6 percent in 2026. This strong performance is expected despite a challenging global environment. Resilient consumer spending and significant public investment will largely counter the impact of higher US tariffs. India will continue to be the world's fastest-growing major economy.

articles.title: India's FY26 GDP growth may exceed NSO estimate after base year revision: SBI report
articles.summary: According to the report, the first advance estimate (AE) released by the National Statistical Office pegs GDP growth at 7.4 per cent in FY26, compared to 6.5 per cent in FY25. Gross Value Added (GVA) growth is estimated at 7.3 per cent, while nominal GDP growth is projected at 8 per cent.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Fewer customs duty slabs, simplified tariff structure soon
articles.summary: Union Budget: India plans to simplify its customs duty structure. The government is considering reducing the number of duty slabs to five or six. This move aims to cut down on disputes and make import duties align better with national priorities. The upcoming budget is expected to announce these changes.

articles.title: India’s GDP growth estimated at 7.4% in FY26: Government data
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow by 7.4% in FY26, surpassing earlier expectations and driven by increased investment and a manufacturing surge. This expansion is expected to push the nation's GDP beyond the $4 trillion mark, supported by accommodative policies and favorable domestic conditions despite global uncertainties.

articles.title: Synthetic mint dents India's grip on global mentha market
articles.summary: India's natural mentha oil industry faces a crisis. Exports and production have fallen significantly. Synthetic mint, a cheaper lab-grown alternative, is flooding markets. Farmers are shifting to other crops as demand for natural mentha wanes. Bulk buyers now prefer the synthetic version for its consistent quality and lower cost. This trend threatens the future of India's natural mint farming.

articles.title: Cotton imports zoom as traders reap zero duty window benefit
articles.summary: In an unprecedented move, India has brought in three million cotton bales during the December quarter, spurred by a newly established duty-free window. This influx can be attributed to declining domestic yields and crop damage affecting quality. With projections indicating sustained high imports through FY26, mills have fortified their inventories of cotton, securing supplies until May or June.

articles.title: India must rein in imports, push exports: Nitin Gadkari
articles.summary: India aims to be the world's third-largest economy. Minister Nitin Gadkari stated this requires reducing imports and boosting exports. He highlighted converting agricultural waste into a national resource. This process can cut pollution from crop burning. It also strengthens the circular economy. Blending 15% with agro-waste can save foreign exchange. This will significantly reduce dependence on imported crude oil.

articles.title: India’s economy to outperform in FY26 with 7.4% growth: HDFC
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth in FY26. Gross Domestic Product is projected to expand by 7.4 percent. This expansion is driven by private consumption and government investment. Services and manufacturing sectors are expected to perform well. Growth is anticipated to moderate in the second half of the fiscal year.

articles.title: Centre sets guidelines for AI-driven cancer diagnosis
articles.summary: India now regulates AI software for cancer detection. These tools analyze medical images like X-rays and CT scans. They are now classified as Class C medical devices. This means they need official approval and safety checks. Developers must follow quality standards. This move ensures patient safety as AI use grows in healthcare.

articles.title: India's GDP pegged to grow at 7.4% for FY26 despite tariff heat
articles.summary: India anticipates robust economic growth of 7.4% in fiscal 2025-26. This projection highlights the nation's economic strength despite global challenges. The government's initiatives, including tax relief and GST adjustments, are expected to boost consumer demand. Manufacturing and services sectors are poised for significant expansion, positioning India as a leading economy in Asia.
